intro: Verticordia integra, commonly known as the pink fairy or the pink wattle-leaf, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking pink to magenta flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is found in heathland and woodland habitats. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are clustered in dense, showy inflorescences. It is a short-lived perennial, often flowering in late winter to early spring.
